column4: I'm going to bitch for a moment about my fresh amd64 Ubuntu install.
I can to people who say that it's awesome.
Ahem.
Why not?  They are problems.  :)
1) Randomly focus changes do not work, necessitating a ctrl-alt-backspace.  Apps still run and accept input.
2) The shitty old version of Skype available does not function with Pulseaudio.
It's not an app that is frozen; the whole desktop gets frozen.
3) I have to constantly 'metacity --replace' and 'compiz --replace' to get video to be watchable without retarded amounts of shearing.
4) At every login, a notification that I need to restart firefox appears so that updates can be applied.
It's lame OS limitations caused by nerds who have no appreciation of aestethics.
ff 3, there is a known bug for that issue, I have a workaround
for ff restart issue try this    sudo killall -9 -r firefox
sudo apt-get purge firefox firefox-3.0 ubufox
the notification appears every time, after reboots and all.
sudo apt-get install --reinstall firefox firefox-3.0 firefox-3.0-gnome-support
yes, I know, follow those steps
